The tension force F in the rope, the normal force N from the ring, the weight of the ball mg (downward)
Coordinate system with origin O at the center of the ring, y-axis upward, x-axis horizontally
Ball located at point P on the ring, making angle θ with the vertical
Sum of all forces must be zero for static equilibrium
Decomposing tension force F into components: F_x = F·sin(θ), F_y = F·cos(θ)
Decomposing normal force N into components: N_x = -N·sin(θ), N_y = -N·cos(θ)
Decomposing weight force mg into components: (mg)_x = 0, (mg)_y = -mg
Equilibrium in the x-direction: F·sin(θ) = N·sin(θ), leading to F = N
Equilibrium in the y-direction: (F - N)·cos(θ) = mg
Substituting F = N into y-direction equation leads to contradiction

Correcting normal force direction: N_x = -N·sin(θ), N_y = -N·cos(θ)
Equilibrium in the x-direction: F·sin(θ) = N·sin(θ), leading to F = N
